result.execSummary:
The defendant Forrest David Smith-Weger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Forrest David Smith-Weger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Forrest David Smith-Weger was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).
  • Forrest David Smith-Weger was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Forrest David Smith-Weger in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Forrest David Smith-Weger in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the revocation packet.  Atty Gumz received a copy of the revocation packet and have no changes.  
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Cts. 1 & 2:  Court orders 8 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber, concurrent to each other
Sentence to start Forthwith; Defendant is to remain in custody
May serve in Sauk County
Credit = 62 days
Civil Judgment entered for $930.30


BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Hendee states that we are back on the record due to an email from Atty Gumz regarding credit.  Atty Gumz states that there should be 77 days of credit and states the dates of incarceration.
Atty Hendee stipulates to that credit.

BY THE COURT:  JOC will be amended to 77 days of credit.
to Produce
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 23, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
to Court from DOC

Defendant Forrest David Smith-Weger in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Forrest David Smith-Weger in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was set for a bond hearing however, the parties have resolution today.  Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Criminal Trespass, 943.14, Class A Misd. and Ct. 2 to Misd. Theft, 943.20(1a(3a), Class A Misd.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1 & Ct. 2.  Ct. 3 to be dismissed.  Atty Hendee asks the court to give him 30 days to file Restitution request if any.
Atty Gumz agrees. 
BY THE COURT:  Court will amend Ct. 1 to Criminal Trespass, 943.14, Class A Misd. and Ct. 2 to Misd. Theft, 943.20(1a(3a), Class A Misd.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1 Criminal Trespass, 943.14, Class A Misd. and Ct. 2 Misd. Theft, 943.20(1a(3a), Class A Misd.
Ct. 3 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Counts 1 & 2:  Withhold Sentence; 2 years Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
DNA Sample + $200 Surcharge on each count
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Court gives 30 days for the State to file any Restitution request.  If the defense contests that request; the court will set a hearing.
Credit to be determined by counsel by stipulation
Ct. 3 to be dismissed.
Bail/bond hearing on February 15, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
for Modification of Bail
of Warrant Cancellation
BY THE COURT:  Warrant satisfied; defendant picked up on Warrant
Return date on March 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Forrest David Smith-Weger in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was taken into Sauk County over the weekend on our warrant.  
BY THE COURT:  Defendant appears in court; warrant satisfied.

Atty Gumz states that the defendant has not been living with his mother in Endeavor and has been staying with friends in Baraboo.  

Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond.
Atty Gumz makes bond arguments.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions:
Set for Return  Return date scheduled for March 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Signed by BNB/12-21-16

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant failed to appear at the last scheduled hearing as well.    Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  
Atty Gumz states that he did just meet with his client in his office last Monday; asks for a stay of the warrant.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
Return date on December 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Per agreement by DA.  Set for Return 12/21/16 at 1:30 p.m.
Signed by BNB/11-3-2016

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he is unable to contact his client and not sure why he is not here.    Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
Return date on November 3, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Forrest David Smith-Weger in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return
bond continued  Return date scheduled for November 3, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

DA Cover Letter w/State's Discovery Demand
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

from Atty Hendee to reset the Prelim set for Sept. 21st; officer not available.  Ok'd by Judge.
Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
*Not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
Defendant will waive the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds time limits waives freely, voluntarily and intelligenty.

Defendant Forrest David Smith-Weger in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $2,000.00 signature bond with conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
